alert.note: Alert for Concho; Crockett; Kimble; Menard; Schleicher; Sutton; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 8:52PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Schleicher, northwestern Kimble, southeastern Tom Green, southeastern Crockett, western Menard, southwestern Concho and Sutton Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 851 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from just south of Christoval to far southwestern Crockett County. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sonora, Eldorado, Menard, Ozona, Fort Mckavett, Live Oak, Adams, Camp Sol Mayer, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1828 And Ranch Road 915, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405, Us- 277 Near The Sutton- Schleicher County Line, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, Us-83 Near The Menard-Concho County Line, I- 10 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 277 And Ranch Road 189, The Intersection Of I- 10 And Ranch Road 1989, Us-277 Near The Sutton- Edwards County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 1828, The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973 and Us-190 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 351 and 429. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Concho; Crockett; Kimble; Menard; Schleicher; Sutton; Tom Green
